attributes.action: Allow Hire & Reward Insurance holders to use Loading Bays and Taxi Lanes
attributes.additional_details:
H&R Insurance is mandatory for last mile delivery work. These two changes would:
- make delivery workers job more efficient
- improves economy for all relevant parties
- reduce traffic 
- improves health and safety (hot food order arrives faster to customer)
- reduces confrontations with Civil Enforcement Officers and public members
- reduce fraudulent behaviour because many gig workers aren't working with correct insurance.
attributes.background:
1) Change the use of Loading Bay law that H&R policy holders would be allowed to use them too. 
2) Consider H&R insurance holders as Taxis, or "Authorized Vehicles" so they can use dedicated roads 

Civil Enforment Officers and ANPR system could have access to insurance database to check drivers

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about who can use loading areas and designated lanes on local roads are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.
